name: Singaraja Hotel (ex- POP! Hotel Hardys Singaraja Square)
address: Jl. Surapati No.12 14, Kp. Baru, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81113, Indonesia
review 1: It has quite small room, and the hallway is quite dirty, but it has great panorama, we can have breakfast under the trees near the beach
review 2: Few days ago My wife and me stayed 2 night at singaraja hotel. We were  very satisfied . Their staff so kind and friendly. Foods and drinks so awesome . Only one thing i want to say. I was watting little bit long time  our food specially for our dinner time. But overall everything is perfect
review 3:
Because its cheap, cant complaint too much. The hotel have a very great location
Surrounded by great restaurants and street food. The room itself its okay. The bed sheet is clean BUTTT the towel is kindda disgusting. It was very smell when it get wet. I think its better to upgrade the cleaness of the hotel. The lobby is also kindda dirty. But the service is very nice. All the staff were very nice and helpful.
review 4: Stayed here for 1 night, the room is small with typical Pop Hotel's design. The location is great, beachfront and plenty space of parking.
review 5: Good place to short stay located next Historical port of singaraja & beachfront,,,theres no garden, building concept hotel. sometimes bad smell cause the river.

name: Warung Bik Juk
address: Kampung Kajanan, Buleleng, Buleleng Regency, Bali 81113, Indonesia
review 1:
Surprisingly, a really good warung that‚Äôs hidden in the alley of Singaraja‚Äôs CBD.

The place is not too big and there‚Äôs no AC in the warung, so please expect the hotness cause Singaraja doesn‚Äôt play with its sunny weather.

Their nasi campur is really good, every bit of the protein tasted clean and savory or sweet. The price is also not expensive at all for the portion. I also tried their rawon, it‚Äôs good but not really my taste. The spices are different to what Rawon usually taste like.

Overall, a must try warung when you‚Äôre in Singaraja.
review 2: So in love with the food, very simple but tasty. Affordable price but for the location a bit difficult to find because you have to entry "gang" street and hard to get car parking. 1 portion plus drink is about 25k IDR. And the best "Keripik Paru" I ever eat.
review 3: A hidden treasure in the heart of Singaraja City. Traditional Indonesian food with delicious taste yet really cheap. Reminds us with grandma's lunch... yumm...
review 4: Nice warung on the side street. They were out of the cow brains, but I managed to try the very little bit they had left plus some other meats with rice. They specialize in beef and it was all good.
review 5: Nostalgic place at singaraja.. good and friendly staff.. the mixed rice is very special you will not find it at Denpasar

name: Harbour Tourist Area of Buleleng
address: Jl. Pelabuhan Buleleng, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81113, Indonesia
review 1: Only had a fleeting visit here, came by coach, only 2 wc so long queue.  Not up to Thai temple standards.
review 2: The Harbour Tourist Area in Buleleng offers a captivating blend of cultural charm and coastal beauty. Nestled along the serene harbor, it boasts vibrant markets, where local artisans showcase their craftsmanship. The picturesque waterfront invites visitors to savor fresh seafood while enjoying panoramic views. The area's rich maritime history is reflected in its museums and historic sites. From colorful boats to lively street performances, the Harbour Tourist Area provides a delightful experience for those seeking a taste of local life amidst a stunning coastal backdrop.
review 3:
Its ine of nice place you must visit when you come to north part of Bali, Singaraja. This place full of memories. I remember this place when I was child. Its always crowded, full of boat, fisherman, snack counter etc etc. Now the current government renovate and make this harbour even more beautiful. Nice place to spend time with families. Beautiful sunset. Lots of place and cafe to have lunch/ dinner. The surrounding just beautiful.
Saw lots of families came here and took the children play on the beach or just go to mini carrousel. There is also Buddhist temple so good place to visit and pray.
My friend really love this place. It just beautiful, calm and relaxing place to meet people.
review 4: A historical place for the Balinese people, especially the Singaraja people as an international port during the colonial era. Of course, I long to see the relic but the museum is closed. More visitors come on holidays and weekends but the museum is closed. This place needs to be improved more, the beaches are still dirty and there is a lot of rubbish while many local people swim.
review 5:
It's a good place to relax with you friends and family or just having some "me time", you can sit at the beachside and enjoy the view, or you can buy food at the food court in the pasar senggol area.

Sadly, this place in overall lacks the lighting, so that if you want to enjoy eating food and drinking your beverages at night, you must hold your phone out with the flashlight on.

There is also several beggars (most are not annoying to me), but this one particular beggar is really annoying because he just beg for money (I'm pretty sure he use that money for buying cigarette). When you don't give him any money, he will be mad and threaten you by saying gibberish that I've never really understood. One time he came to multiple visitors for more than once (and he came to me like 6 times), and threatened them. When this beggar happened to threatened me and my companion while we just chatting, we threaten to call the Satpol PP on him and he just left. This goes on for a while until he left because of how small amount of money he can only get that night.

Overall, this place offer great view with foods and beverages available. Yet, sadly the facilities are lacking (not to mention that one sink near the monument is broken), with several beggars that may or may not annoy you.

Oh yeah ticket for the motorcycle is Rp.2.000 (you pay for parking ticket at the entrance), yet inside at the parking space it says Rp.1.000, so... idk. I don't know the fee (or parking ticket price) for car.

name: Abuela Coffee
address: Jl. Erlangga No.1, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81114, Indonesia
review 1: One word, underrated! How come place like this in Singaraja is not crowded as hell. This hidden gem is located in the very heart of Singaraja city, the place spacious and nice. The food taste is outstanding! I ordered coffee and bread and they are so incredible. It gives different taste from the other coffee caf√©. The staff is warm and friendly. I will come again soon!
review 2: Coffee shop with good food and coffee. Very nice ambiance.
review 3: Small cafe, the coffee is good, the dimsum is tasty. The staff is friendly, the only downside is the chair in the outdoor area. You can‚Äôt possibly sit comfortably in a chair without a backrest.
review 4:
Love this place ü´∂
Great coffee ‚òïÔ∏è
Lumpia is also really nice ü•ü
Internet is fast ‚ö°Ô∏è
And the staff are really sweet üå∫
Prices are really good for the quality. I was here the whole day which is why my bill is higher. But I had 7 things off the menu!
review 5: Best coffee in Singaraja. Cappuccino was 20k and options don‚Äôt exceed 25k. Great vibe. Wifi is patchy, so bring your own hotspot. Cafe offers indoor, air-conditioned seating and outdoor seating too. Board and card games available. Not too crowded when I went at 1 pm and again at 8 pm.

name: Klenteng Ling Gwan Kiong
address: Jl. Erlangga No.65, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81114, Indonesia
review 1: This temple is located in Singaraja, located in the city area. It is not difficult to find the location, because it is located not far from the highway. The place is very clean and well maintained. The atmosphere is very sacred, unfortunately when I was there 2 years ago, and it was in a period of restoration. There is also some photo spot near the temple. I will visit again when I have more time.
review 2: Taoist temple with beautiful old-chinese architecture. Built in 1873 but still in very good condition and clean. Located right in front of the beach.
review 3:
Ling Gwan Kiong is an old Chinese temple popular that overlooks the now-defunct seaport complex in Singaraja, North Bali.
The temple is only a short walk away from the seaside Pura Segara temple.
The temple dates back to 1873 with connections to the Ching Dynasty and is a silent witness to the towns colourful past.
review 4: The Tri Dharma Temple, very unique, historic and well maintained temple. In this temple three different religions are celebrated, Taoism, Confucianism as well as Chinese Buddhism.
review 5: Quiet, clean and peaceful. Visited this place and one of the caretaker was welcoming. Well maintained and clean.

name: Ikan Bakar Tanjung Alam Dermaga
address: Kampung Bugis, Buleleng, Buleleng Regency, Bali 81114, Indonesia
review 1: We came here for dinner, food was good, i like sweet & spicy squid, for me the chilly sambal on the grilled fish need more improvement (tasteless), tom yum soup not even close to the original, competitive price ( food price in the menu except the grilled fish since you need to weigh it first). It was windy when we go there, overall good
review 2: The food was good. The view is wonderful. It's a good place to watch the sunset and enjoy the evening with a beer and something to eat. I would recommend the restaurant to others.
review 3: Nice place for dinner with family. Good place with a sunset view
review 4: This was the highlight of Singaraja. A nice cold breeze and a great view over the ocean. There are a few different restaurants. When we were there on a Wednesday afternoon it was very quiet. But we heard it was a popular place for the locals to hang out in the weekends.
review 5: Always enjoyed our meal here. But for chili or tomato sauce they using sachet instead bowl or sauce dish plate. I'd prefer they use sauce dish, but well this not fine dine resto anyway so cannot expect much.

name: Warung Nasi Hadijah
address: V3VQ+HXW, Kampung Kajanan, Buleleng, Buleleng Regency, Bali 81113, Indonesia
review 1:
They have 3 menus. Chicken, beef, or mixed. There are 2 soups, Kari and Rawon. For the chicken, you can only get Kari. I tried the mixed with Rawon soup base. It was really good. You may want to ask for extra soup. For one portion, you need to pay 25k IDR. All drinks are 5k, all crackers are 7k.

There's a limited parking lot so you may want to park a little far and walk to this place.
review 2:
1 portion for Beef Rice was 35k

Not bad üëå
review 3: LOVE IT! The best paru goreng I ever had!
review 4: Soo amaaaazing! Really must try in Singaraja!
review 5: One of popular food at Singaraja

name: Rumah Makan Padang Denai
address: Jl. Imam Bonjol No.84, Kp. Kajanan, Singaraja, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81151, Indonesia
review 1: Most delicious rendang I've ever tried! Is a must if your visiting Indonesia
review 2: Small space, reasonable price, good food

name: SEBLAK BOSQUE
address: Singaraja, V3VP+MGW, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81115, Indonesia

name: Bubur Ayam Jakarta
address: Jl. Imam Bonjol No.76, Kp. Kajanan, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81113, Indonesia

name: Sate Plecing
address: Jl. Imam Bonjol Gang Mimbar No.1, Kp. Kajanan, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81113, Indonesia
review 1: Did not meet my expectation...dirty table, not comfortable place to dine in, quality of food is below expectation
review 2: Sate itself very juicy..  The sauce little bit tasteless but still nice for its spicy
review 4: Not delicious at all, and there is no special about this place
review 5: Nice place,  fair price..  Good meat

name: Bubur Ayam Merak Bang Irfan
address: V3VP+632, Jl. Merak, Kp. Anyar, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81116, Indonesia

name: Warung Nasi NAZAR
address: Jl. Hasanudin No.52, Singaraja, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81114, Indonesia
review 1:
Super yum rawon (beef stew with spices)!
Definitely a place for carnivores as they don't serve any veggies
Love their sambal as well!
Try the "es bir" --- Buleleng style coconut drink with lime
Perfect for lunch on a hot day!
review 2: I like this better than Nasi Bik Juk.

name: Royal Sunset
address: V3WQ+M88, Jl. Pelabuhan Buleleng, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81114, Indonesia
review 1:
Great location for sunset watching.
Typical Balinese food at very accessible prices.
Service is excellent.
Staff very
Shame the flies will permanently try to share your food.

Note for the owner, get some citronella tea candles to keep flies and mosquitoes away.
review 2:
My very first time having meals here. The menu is various, Indonesian seafood to Western. The food was so so. I neither dislike it, it's just okay. The price range from IDR 5k up to 100k++ (for package). The place (with 3 others) is floating above the beach, which looks interesting. I like the ambience, the view of the beach on the northern accompanied with the sound of the waves, and the lights were so romantic at night.
If you visit Singaraja city, try to spot this area, in Ex-Buleleng Harbour.
review 3:
A Hidden Gem on the Bali Sea!

I have had the pleasure of visiting Singaraja on numerous occasions, and as a westerner, I have had issues with the tradition cuisine as my palate can‚Äôt tolerate the level of heat and the lack of greens. I recently stumbled upon a hidden gem that completely exceeded my expectations. Tucked away atop a pier overlooking the Bali sea, Royal Sunset Resto turned out to be an extraordinary surprise. It was so impressive, I dined a second time a day later.

The serene atmosphere, with the sound of gentle waves and the refreshing sea breeze, creates an idyllic setting that immediately transports you to a place of tranquility.
Contrary to the traditional warung scene in Singaraja, Royal Sunset Resto offers a fresh version that celebrates the local products. The culinary offerings here are an absolute delight for the palate. The menu showcases traditional fare along with some western staples. I recommend to try the traditional cuisine offered, you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Oh, and don‚Äôt worry, they will temper the heat to your tolerance!

From the moment the dishes arrived at the table, it was evident that Royal Sunset Resto takes immense pride in their culinary creations. Each plate took me on a culinary journey of Bali. The freshness of the ingredients was evident the minute the dishes came out. Fish that was caught that morning. Vegetable sourced at the morning‚Äôs local market before dawn. The combination with the talent in the kitchen was perfection.

Dishes that celebrates the rich tapestry of Balinese cuisine that are a must when dining at Royal Sunset Resto are as follows:

* Paket Ikan Bakar  (special of the house)
* Pepes Ikan (grilled fish wrapped in banana leaf)
* Cah kangkung (morning glory)
* Udang Krispi (fried prawns)
* Perkedel Jagung (corn fritters)
* Cumi krispy (freshly prepared not frozen calamari)

Apart from the extraordinary culinary experience, the service at Royal Restaurant deserves a special mention. The staff members were attentive, courteous, and genuinely passionate about ensuring a memorable dining experience for every guest. Their knowledge of the menu and recommendations were invaluable in making our visit truly exceptional.

If you find yourself in Singaraja, don't miss the opportunity to indulge in the culinary wonders of Royal Restaurant. It offers a refreshing departure from the traditional local warungs, providing a unique and elevated dining experience. The breathtaking location, delectable cuisine, and impeccable service make it a true gem on the Bali Sea. Royal Restaurant has certainly left an indelible mark on my culinary journey, and I cannot recommend it enough for those seeking a memorable and delightful dining experience. For those who may wonder how much this experience may cost? The image I have uploaded of the dishes on the table cost US$35/IDR35K including beverages & beer. Mind Blowing!!

To the owner: if I could be so bold to recommend having images of local Balinese life on the wall rather than the inspirational quotes. As a diner, if I don‚Äôt get the view of the sea and have to look at the wall, it would be much more pleasant.
review 4: Nice place on the water. Good food for a good price. Detailed menu. Staff give very good service. Parking in front
review 5:
This warung Royal Sunset is the best warung on the beach with nice view on the the first left side.
The best food and cheaper then the others.
We eat ther weekly already more then three years. Many important people eat there too.
All kind of fish very large seafood platter.
Nasi Goreng chicken or seafood.
Bami goreng.
Sat√© chicken.
Udang
Cumi cumi
Pork ribs
Many more food
Steak beef, chicken, hamburger, chicken cordonblue.
Special children menu, Drinks very good price.
Friendly staff
Top!!!!

name: Bali Intan Cafe
address: Singaraja, Jl. Erlangga No.11, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81115, Indonesia
types: restaurant, coffee_shop, cafe, bakery, wholesaler, food, store
review 1:
A Singaraga Gem...
Highly recommended...
A family run cafe with an excellent menu that's designed to cater to local tastes and Western tastes.
Easy to find with great signage.
There's street parking available outside.
When you approach the cafe, you will be greeted with a friendly
"Hello and come inside."
from the owners Dad who sits outside to greet all customers and thank all those who are leaving.
This sort of customer experience is very unique in Indonesia. it's amazing.
Inside is a modern clean cafe, with smiling staff.
The menu is limited but does include anything that either a Western or local dinner will require.
There is  complementary water provided for each customer and also a small gratis piece of "desert," which is a nice touch.
The food ordered was promptly served and tasted great.

Would I come back again ?
Most Definitely!!
They have a great menu!!
review 2:
All of their food was excellent. I went there to study and have a good time. The cafe is not noisy and perfect if you want to bring your laptop to study/work. They give you free cold water

The staff was so friendly. She give me a cute little piece of bread pudding and that was amazing too.

They surely need to improve their coffee quality. I order iced long black and it was not the best. But they have plenty of beverage option. And a free refill iced tea too. Might be my fav. place to ‚Äústudy from cafe‚Äù in Singaraja
review 3: Surprisingly amazing place for work. There are coffee, wifi and toilet. Good Indonesian food, great service and really good ambiance. I‚Äôve spent more than 5hours working here and definitely goin back üëç
review 4: Good place to spend your time when in holidays or at the weekend; the food is delicious, with a mix of local Indonesian menus, with Tionghoan (Chinese) food and dishes, and along with Westerns foods. Fit for all kind of tounges, locals and foreigners alike.
review 5: This is a great restaurant, with very good food and coffee. Highly recommended.

name: Babi Guling Surti
address: Jl. Hasanudin No.90, Kp. Kajanan, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81113, Indonesia

name: Warung Men Cobek
address: V3WQ+PC3 Dermaga Eks, Jl. Pelabuhan Buleleng, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81114, Indonesia
review 1: Good foods and good view not expensive
review 2:
The price is economical,
The fried chicken, the smoked chicken and the grill beef rib are the best.
The restaurant is about the sea.
Nice place to see sunset

name: Warung Nasi Rawon Pangi
address: V3VQ+999, Jl. Manggis, Kp. Kajanan, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81114, Indonesia

name: Restoran Terapung Ex. Pelabuhan Buleleng
address: Jl. Erlangga, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81113, Indonesia
review 1: You can find many variety of snack with cheap price here. The place is good, just need a little improve in hygiene.
review 2: Beast restaurant out of the 4 for quality of food and service. Its all priced at local prices as there are not a lot of international tourists in the town. (extremely cheap for European travellers) The food is to a very good standard and would highly recommend it
review 3: Nice place n of course foods too

name: Museum Soenda Ketjil
address: Jl. Pelabuhan Buleleng, Kp. Bugis, Kec. Buleleng, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81114, Indonesia
review 1: A nice little museum capturing a brief history of the once important Spends Ketjil region. The displays are in Indonesian language but there are translations in English on cards. Interesting history about how the area was once the capital before they moved it to Denpasar.
